info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued October 09 at 3:32AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: Corrected time of storm information ...TROPICAL STORM BOLAVEN MOVING WEST-NORTHWEST AND INTENSIFYING... .NEW INFORMATION... Tropical Storm Bolaven continues to approach the Marianas. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Watch continues for Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. .STORM INFORMATION... At 1 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Bolaven (15W) was located near latitude 10.0N...longitude 151.7E. This was about 520 miles east-southeast of Guam. Storm Motion was west-northwest. Storm Intensity was 50 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... As Tropical Storm Bolaven approaches Guam and the CNMI, the biggest hazard will be wind damage, followed by flooding, with inundation also being a concern. It is too early to provide exact wind and surge forecast values for specific locations. A general concern should be for the possibility of widespread damage somewhere in either Guam or the Northern Marianas. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 AM ChST...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Watch remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Probability of tropical storm/typhoon conditions... Tropical storm or typhoon conditions are likely from Tuesday noon to Wednesday afternoon. This represents a general upward trend since the last forecast. The onset of tropical storm conditions could start as early as mid-morning Tuesday. The onset of typhoon conditions could start as early as Tuesday evening. ...Winds... As Tropical Storm Bolaven (15W) moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds is likely to increase. The latest forecast is for Typhoon force winds from late Tuesday night to early Wednesday morning. Tropical storm force winds are currently forecast to begin affecting the area early Tuesday afternoon. ...Inundation and Seas... Inundation of 2 to 4 feet is likely as Bolaven passes through, particularly if you are near the center. Seas of 20 to 24 feet are possible. Hazardous surf conditions are possible beginning this evening and continuing through at least Thursday. The highest surf conditions are expected to begin along east and possibly south facing reefs on Tuesday as Bolaven nears. Surf will increase and likely become dangerous for north and west facing reefs on Wednesday as Bolaven passes to the northwest of the Marianas. ...Inland flooding... A Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. See latest forecast for latest information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location...and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
info.instruction: For those under a watch...now is the time to prepare your home or business according to your typhoon disaster plan. Listen for possible warnings and be ready to evacuate if necessary. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports...docks...and marinas...it is recommended that you perform the prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat...safely secure your craft and make plans to leave it for adequate land based shelter. Listen for possible warnings. Regarding the coastal waters under a watch...small craft should return to port or seek safe harbor. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information... Please refer to the detailed recommendations relative to your location as further described by your local National Weather Service office and your local emergency management.
